title: (x) Shout Out Louds band logo - hand lettered (based on Bodoni) {Ryan, Mark S}
content:
can anyone identify the typeface used for the "shout out louds" text banner at the top of [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20140313121402/http:/www.shoutoutlouds.com/) page?

thank you!

-alex0
author: alexhb

comments.content: Well, the glpyhs don't match up exactly... which leads to the conclusion that this is hand-drawn. It seems to probably be based off of an existing font, though.

Is it possible that this is just drawn by hand?  
The U is not exactly the same in LOUDS (right serif sticks out, upper right corner is thinner and curved different to the other two instances), upper S serif is slanted more in LOUDS.
is there anything similar you could recemmend?

check out this list of handlettered roman fonts compiled by [Stewf](http://web.archive.org/web/20140313121402/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Stephen%20Coles):

[http://typographi.com/000737](http://web.archive.org/web/20140313121402/http:/typographi.com/000737 "http://typographi.com/000737")
The letterforms seem to be based on Bodoni. I agree that it is probably hand lettered.
